body_html: Some new convolutional layers invented in the last few months for superresolution etc. require further division of the H and W dimension like [N, C, H, H_sub, W, W_sub]. Although the slicing can be simulated via reshaping and slicing in a lower rank tensor, it's just doesn't feel right when T.transpose() and T.reshape() are both supported for rank 6 tensor and T.slice() isn't.

body: Some new convolutional layers invented in the last few months for superresolution etc. require further division of the H and W dimension like [N, C, H, H_sub, W, W_sub]. Although the slicing can be simulated via reshaping and slicing in a lower rank tensor, it's just doesn't feel right when T.transpose() and T.reshape() are both supported for rank 6 tensor and T.slice() isn't.
